intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium macrogrovesianum subsp. macrogrovesianum, commonly known as the Macrogrovesian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and roadsides. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, and its leaves are alternate, rough, and often covered in fine hairs. This subspecies is distinguished by its relatively large, robust leaves and its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
